Deprecated API

Contents

  • Classes
  • Methods
  • Classes 
    Class Description
    brave.http.HttpAdapter
    Since 5.10, use HttpRequest and HttpResponse
    brave.http.HttpClientAdapter
    Since 5.10, use HttpClientRequest and HttpClientResponse
    brave.http.HttpClientParser
    Since 5.10, use HttpRequestParser and HttpResponseParser
    brave.http.HttpParser
    Since 5.10, use HttpRequestParser and HttpResponseParser
    brave.http.HttpSampler
    Since 5.8, use SamplerFunction<HttpRequest>.
    brave.http.HttpServerAdapter
    Since 5.10, use HttpServerRequest and HttpServerResponse
    brave.http.HttpServerParser
    Since 5.10, use HttpRequestParser and HttpResponseParser
  • Methods 
    Method Description
    brave.http.HttpAdapter.statusCode​(Resp)
    Since 5.7, use HttpAdapter.statusCodeAsInt(Object) which prevents boxing.
    brave.http.HttpClientAdapter.parseServerIpAndPort​(Req, Endpoint.Builder)
    remote IP information should be added directly by instrumentation. This will be removed in Brave v6.
    brave.http.HttpClientHandler.create​(HttpTracing, HttpClientAdapter<Req, Resp>)
    Since 5.7, use HttpClientHandler.create(HttpTracing) as it is more portable.
    brave.http.HttpClientHandler.handleReceive​(Resp, Throwable, Span)
    since 5.12 use HttpClientHandler.handleReceive(HttpClientResponse, Span)
    brave.http.HttpClientHandler.handleSend​(TraceContext.Injector<Req>, Req)
    Since 5.7, use HttpClientHandler.handleSend(HttpClientRequest), as this allows more advanced samplers to be used.
    brave.http.HttpClientHandler.nextSpan​(Req)
    since 5.8 use Tracer.nextSpan(SamplerFunction, Object)
    brave.http.HttpParser.errorParser()
    This is only used in Zipkin reporting. Since 5.12, use ZipkinSpanHandler.Builder.errorTag(Tag)
    brave.http.HttpRuleSampler.Builder.addRule​(String, String, float)
    Since 5.8, use HttpRuleSampler.Builder.putRule(Matcher, Sampler)
    brave.http.HttpRuleSampler.trySample​(HttpAdapter<Req, ?>, Req)
    brave.http.HttpServerAdapter.parseClientAddress​(Req, Endpoint.Builder)
    HttpServerAdapter.parseClientIpAndPort(Req, brave.Span) addresses this functionality. This will be removed in Brave v6.
    brave.http.HttpServerHandler.create​(HttpTracing, HttpServerAdapter<Req, Resp>)
    Since 5.7, use HttpServerHandler.create(HttpTracing) as it is more portable.
    brave.http.HttpServerHandler.handleReceive​(TraceContext.Extractor<Req>, Req)
    Since 5.7, use HttpServerHandler.handleReceive(HttpServerRequest)
    brave.http.HttpServerHandler.handleSend​(Resp, Throwable, Span)
    Since 5.12, use HttpServerHandler.handleSend(HttpServerResponse, Span)
    brave.http.HttpTracing.Builder.clientParser​(HttpClientParser)
    Since 5.10, use HttpTracing.Builder.clientRequestParser(HttpRequestParser) and HttpTracing.Builder.clientResponseParser(HttpResponseParser)
    brave.http.HttpTracing.Builder.clientSampler​(HttpSampler)
    Since 5.8, use HttpTracing.Builder.clientSampler(SamplerFunction)
    brave.http.HttpTracing.Builder.serverParser​(HttpServerParser)
    Since 5.10, use HttpTracing.Builder.serverRequestParser(HttpRequestParser) and HttpTracing.Builder.serverResponseParser(HttpResponseParser)
    brave.http.HttpTracing.Builder.serverSampler​(HttpSampler)
    Since 5.8, use HttpTracing.Builder.serverSampler(SamplerFunction)
    brave.http.HttpTracing.clientParser()
    Since 5.10, use HttpTracing.clientRequestParser() and HttpTracing.clientResponseParser()
    brave.http.HttpTracing.clientSampler()
    Since 5.8, use HttpTracing.clientRequestSampler()
    brave.http.HttpTracing.serverParser()
    Since 5.10, use HttpTracing.serverRequestParser() and HttpTracing.serverResponseParser()
    brave.http.HttpTracing.serverSampler()
    Since 5.8, use HttpTracing.serverRequestSampler()
